conclusion: Use principles of optics related to light refraction and properties of the liquid to solve the problem.
Determine the distance at which the light source S needs to be moved vertically upward so that it is not visible above the water surface.
Identify given values: radius of the circular board r, depth of the point light source H = √3r, refractive index of the liquid n = √2.
Distance from the center to the light source is H - r = √3r - r = √2r.
Use refractive index n = √2 to relate distances.
Distance from the center O to the light source S is √2r.
Distance from the center O to the water surface is r.
Distance from the center to the light source S is √2r - r.
